sections.name: Pre Change Request
sections.intro:
These steps may begin starting 26 Jan. Create the Change Request at least 2 weeks prior. Assign your name to the ctasks under the workflow tab after submission. Send site email notice at least 2 weeks prior.

Reference Cookbook: Password Change (v1.7) – Network Locations (2005.2)
Reference: Image Share Permissions

NOTE: Do not edit nor remove the VHA accounts at this time.

items.text: Create a list of active Network Locations that utilize the old VHAxxxIA/IU accounts.
Contact respective system owners to coordinate adding the new OITxxxIA/IU accounts.
Validate new OIT accounts have access to image shares.
Schedule date/time with Clinicomp personnel for post account reconciliation actions.

sections.name: Begin Implementation on the Change Request
sections.intro:
These tasks can be completed during business hours unless otherwise noted.

Primary References:
- Cookbook – Password Change
- Cookbook – Change IA and IU Accounts

Some tasks must be completed during scheduled downtime.

items.text: Reconcile OITxxxIA/IU/IU2 accounts (add to KeePass and RDCM). Close related ctasks.
Add OITAppAdminsCIT3SVC security group to local Administrators and Users on BGPs and DIGs/TXTs servers.
Add OITServerAdminsCIT3 security group to all servers’ local Users group.
Add va\oitXXXia full control permissions to C:\DICOM and C:\DICOM\Image_In folders.
Create C:\DICOM\Scratch folders and confirm IA accounts have full control.
Update Scratch folder in MUMPs on DIGs/TXTs servers.
Update annotated Network Locations using old VHAxxxIA/IU accounts.
Update Apache Tomcat credentials on HDIGs and VIX.
Update IRIS service using new OITxxxIA account.
Sign out, update RDCM credentials, sign in with new account and restart services. Verify functionality.
Update IRIS Management Portal accounts.
Update Lighthouse Web Interface account passwords.
Update Compass Web Interface account passwords.
Update VA\OITxxxIU credentials in BGP Imaging Site Parameters (do early morning).
Change VistA Verify Code (Method 1) using OITxxxIU2 password.
Restart services.
Update MSP referencing correct accounts in CyberArk.
Close open ctasks and complete Change Request.
